text: The Lottery Winners is a British indie pop band from Leigh, Greater Manchester, England. The band was formed by Thom Rylance (vocals/guitar), Robert Lally (guitar/vocals), Katie Lloyd (bass/vocals), and Joe Singleton (drums). ==History== Formed in 2008, original drummer Alex Langford-Taylor was subsequently replaced by long-time friend Joe Singleton, otherwise the line-up has stayed constant since then. Their 2016 song "Young Love" was called a "solid slice of catchy, jingly-jangly, indie-pop" by CDNX. Lottery Winners signed to Modern Sky UK in 2019. They released their first single, "Hawaii", with the label in September 2019. Their debut self-titled studio album reached number 23 on the UK Albums Chart in March 2020. ==Discography== ===Albums=== * The Lottery Winners (March 2020) No. 23 UK ===Singles=== *"Elizabeth" (April 2013) *"I Know" (October 2015) *"Young Love" (April 2016) *"That's Not Entertainment" (November 2018) *"Hawaii" (September 2019) *"Little Things" (November 2019) *"21" (January 2020) *"Headlock" (February 2020) ==References== ==External links== * Lottery Winners official website Category:Musical groups established in 2008 Category:Musical groups from Manchester Category:British indie pop groups Category:Sire Records artists Category:Warner Records artists
title: The Lottery Winners
